Minim Koordinasi, Sektor Pertanian Kerap Jadi Korban
06 Nov 2019, 03:15 by Ecep Sukirman
BANDUNG, (PR).- Minimnya koordinasi menyebabkan pertanian menjadi korban ketidakberesan penataan hulu terkait tidak berhentinya penambangan dan penebangan liar hingga hilir sungai yang rusak oleh pencemaran dan keramba jaring apung. Kementerian Pertanian RI harus berani membenahi koordinasi antar instansi untuk menciptakan sistem pertanian terintegrasi.
Wakil Ketua Komisi IV DPR RI Dedi Mulyadi meminta Menteri Pertanian Syahrul Yasin Limpo memberikan perhatian lebih pada kesejahteraan buruh tani. Dedi mengatakan menteri pertanian  harus berani membenahi koordinasi antar instansi guna menciptakan sistem pertanian terintegrasi yang ujungnya mensejahterakan buruh tani.
Dikatakan Dedi, masalah pertanian di Indonesia ini faktornya setiap kementerian dan organisasi perangkat daerah seolah berjalan sendiri-sendiri.
“Minimnya koordinasi menyebabkan  pertanian menjadi korban dari tidak beresnya penataan hulu terkait tidak berhentinya penambangan dan penebangan liar hingga hilir sungai yang rusak oleh pencemaran dan keramba jaring apung. Musibah seluruh proses ini yang paling “menikmati” adalah pertanian. Dan yang paling menderita itu buruh taninya. Mereka membeli beras dari padi yang ditanam dan sudah dibeli tengkulak dengan upah buruh,” tutur Dedi, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Siklus ini membuat performa para buruh tani makin rendah karena posisi mereka yang makin termajinalkan mengingat kondisi kesejahteraannya tahun ke tahun tidak pernah membaik. “Rumahnya jelek, jaminan kesehatan dan pendidikannya rendah. Dari persfektif ini saya memberikan saran lindungi buruh tani,” katanya.
Dedi mengaku sudah menyampaikan saran tersebut pada Mentan Syahrul Yasin Limpo dalam rapat dengar pendapat agar urusan ini dikedepankan sebagai prioritas membenahi tata kelola pertanian. 
“Berikan buruh tani jaminan kesehatan yang memadai bukan hanya BPJS kesehatan yang disubsidi, berikan jaminan rumah memadai, jaminan pendidikan, agar orangtua berbondong-bondong dan bersedia menjadi buruh tani guna menjaga swasembada pangan," ungkapnya.



Dia juga meminta agar Kementerian Pertanian bersama kementerian lintas bidang konsisten menangani urusan hulu terutama urusan pertambangan yang kini izinnya berada di provinsi. “Tetapkan dengan jelas mana wilayah tambang dan non tambang,” ujarnya.
Pihaknya juga mendesak Kementan turut tegas pada urusan tata ruang yang oleh kepentingan politik kerap kali mengubah areal sawah menjadi areal komersil. Terlebih izin untuk pendirian properti dan industri saat ini makin cepat diproses. “Sebentar lagi daerah penghasil swasembada pangan di Pantura Jabar akan semakin susut dan hilang,” katanya.
Persoalan ini jika tidak ditangani menurutnya akan membuat multidimensi dan kompleks. Karena itu Dedi menegaskan Kementerian Pertanian harus mengambil langkah strategis dengan membenahi koordinasi dari pusat sampai daerah dalam urusan pertanian.***

Lack of Coordination, Agriculture Sector Often Be a Victim
Nov 6 2019, 03:15 by Ecep Sukirman
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The lack of coordination caused agriculture to become victims of irregular upstream structuring related to the cessation of mining and illegal logging downstream of the river which was damaged by pollution and floating net cages. The Indonesian Ministry of Agriculture must have the courage to improve coordination between agencies to create an integrated farming system.
Deputy Chairman of the House of Representatives Commission IV Dedi Mulyadi asked Minister of Agriculture Syahrul Yasin Limpo to pay more attention to the welfare of farm laborers. Dedi said that the minister of agriculture must have the courage to fix coordination between agencies in order to create an integrated farming system that will ultimately improve the welfare of farm laborers.
Dedi said, the agricultural problem in Indonesia was a factor in each ministry and regional apparatus as if it was running separately.
"The lack of coordination causes agriculture to become victims of the erroneous upstream arrangement related to the cessation of mining and illegal logging downstream of the river which is damaged by pollution and floating net cages. The calamity of this whole process that most "enjoyed" was agriculture. And the ones who suffer the most are farm workers. They buy rice from rice planted and have been bought by middlemen with labor costs, "said Dedi, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
This cycle makes the performance of farm workers lower because their position is increasingly marginalized given the condition of their welfare from year to year has never improved. "The house is ugly, health insurance and education are low. From this perspective I give advice on protecting agricultural laborers, "he said.
Dedi claimed to have submitted the suggestion to Minister of Defense Syahrul Yasin Limpo at a hearing to make this matter put forward as a priority to improve agricultural governance.
"Give farm workers adequate health insurance not just subsidized health BPJS, provide adequate housing guarantees, education guarantees, so that parents flock and are willing to become farm workers to maintain food self-sufficiency," he said.



He also requested that the Ministry of Agriculture together with cross-sector ministries be consistent in handling upstream affairs, especially mining matters, whose permits are now in the province. "Clearly define mining and non-mining areas," he said.
He also urged the Ministry of Agriculture to take a firm stand on spatial matters which, by political interests, often turn rice fields into commercial areas. Moreover, permits for the establishment of property and industry are now being processed faster. "Soon the region that produces food self-sufficiency in West Java Pantura will increasingly shrink and disappear," he said.
According to him, this problem will not be multi-dimensional and complex. Therefore Dedi emphasized that the Ministry of Agriculture must take strategic steps to improve coordination from the center to the regions in agricultural affairs. ***
